properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 9:34PM CST until February 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Accumulating Snow Coming to an End, However Bitter Cold and
Windy Conditions Expected Tonight into Thursday Morning...

.A winter storm system will continue across eastern Iowa and
northwest Illinois early into this morning. The snow will be
followed by a strong cold front, which will bring bitter cold
temperatures and strong winds tonight into Thursday. Total snowfall
amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected across northeast Missouri,
portions of eastern Iowa and northwest Illinois. Strong northwest
will cause blowing and drifting snow and lead to wind chill index
readings as low as 15 below to 25 below zero late tonight into
Thursday morning.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow
accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph
tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as
low as 20 below zero Thursday morning.

* WHERE...Portions of northeast Missouri, southeast Iowa and
west central Illinois.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST
Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 AM to noon CST
Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The
cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as
little as 30 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

In Illinois, go to www.gettingaroundillinois.com for road
conditions.
In Iowa, call 511 for road conditions.
In Missouri, call 800-222-6400 for road conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO NOON CST THURSDAY
